page.title: 20Avon Ring Road_Hanham Area
page.content: After public meetings and many written replies Avon County Council have decided on a route for a{major road}on the eastern side of Bristol which is hoped will relieve traffic congestion for a mere 40 million pounds.Other advantages for this road,which will cut a swathe through green fields and houses,would be to form a corridor of{ {development.}The Avon Wildlife Trust and other groups are against the planned route as it will cut through Hanham Hills which has withstood development as an island in a sea of houses and industry. The{loss of {habitat}for wildlife,the increased pollution and noise and reduction of open space concerns many local people. The opposition to this scheme is summed up by the title of a 10 year old child's poem about the Ring Road{ {"Construction - Destruction!" }
